articles.author: Football Italia Staff
articles.title: Jorginho to City next week?
articles.description: Reports in England suggest Manchester City are confident of completing a deal for Napoli midfielder Jorginho next week.

articles.author: Football Italia Staff
articles.title: Balotelli: ‘Nice blew the title’
articles.description: Nice striker Mario Balotelli feels they blew the chance to win Ligue 1 in 2016-17 - “Monaco didn’t win, we lost”.

articles.author: Football Italia Staff
articles.title: Balotelli: ‘Not convinced by Nice’
articles.description: Mario Balotelli admits he wasn’t initially convinced by Nice, but now he won’t rule out staying with the French club.

articles.author: Football Italia Staff
articles.title: ‘Gonalons staying at Roma’
articles.description: Maxime Gonalons’ agent says the midfielder will “100 per cent stay at Roma”, and that he has an “excellent” relationship with Coach Eusebio Di Francesco.

articles.author: Football Italia Staff
articles.title: Inter in London for Dembele
articles.description: Inter sporting director Piero Ausilio will head to London to negotiate with Tottenham Hotspur for Moussa Dembélé, according to reports.

articles.author: Football Italia Staff
articles.title: Juventus meet with Cagliari
articles.description: Juventus sporting director Fabio Paratici has been pictured meeting with Cagliari, reportedly to discuss Han Kwang-song.

articles.author: Football Italia Staff
articles.title: Official: Lopez to leave Cagliari
articles.description: Cagliari have officially confirmed that Coach Diego Lopez will leave the club on June 30 when his contract expires.

articles.author: Football Italia Staff
articles.title: Marcano in Rome today
articles.description: Roma’s communications director confirms Ivan Marcano will arrive in Italy today, ahead of signing on a free transfer.

articles.author: Football Italia Staff
articles.title: Juventus look to Badelj?
articles.description: Juventus could sign Milan Badelj on a free transfer from Fiorentina, according to reports.

articles.author: Football Italia Staff
articles.title: ‘Kalinic wants to stay’
articles.description: Nikola Kalinic's agent admits “the season went badly” at Milan, but the striker “wants to stay”.
